titles.title: As with Gladness Men of Old

comments.comment: This hymnal has not been proofed - data may be incomplete or incorrect

verse.name: v1
v2
verse.lines: As with joyful steps they sped to that lowly cradle-bed, there to bend the knee before Him whom heav'n and earth adore; so may we with willing feet ever seek Thy mercy-seat.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: As they offered gifts most rare at that cradle rude and bare; so may we with holy joy, pure, and free from sinâ€™s alloy, all our costliest treasures bring, Christ, to Thee, our heav'nly King.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Holy Jesus, ev'ry day keep us in the narrow way; and, when earthly things are past, bring our ransomed lives at last where they need no star to guide, where no clouds Thy glory hide.

verse.name: v5
